entry.description: Returns offset of the first occurrence of string sub

entry.template:
# import re ${aregex} = re.compile('${pattern}', re.${UILMSX}) # [re.compile(x) for x in ${pattern_sequence}]
${alst} = ${aregex}.findall(${astr})

entry.description: generator expression, otherwise you can use yield in a function.
Allows globals to be created or changed within a function or class
A key, value pair for a dictionary

entry.template: # Copyright © 2010 ${Abhishek Tiwari} (abhishek@abhishek-tiwari.com) # # This file is part of ${ProjectName}. # # Files included in this package ${ProjectName} are copyrighted freeware # distributed under the terms and conditions as specified in file LICENSE. ${cursor}

entry.description: Lists are mutable (changeable) arrays of object references accessed by offset.
Looping over sequences- tuple, list, string
defult strip whitespace else given char
Applies function to each item of any sequence or other iterable, and returns the individual results
entry.template: map(${function}, ${iterable1}, ${iterable2}, ${}) # iterable objects have a method named next()

entry.description: match regex at the beginning of string
entry.template:
# import re ${aregex} = re.compile('${pattern}', re.${UILMSX}) # [re.compile(x) for x in ${pattern_sequence}]
${matchobj} = ${aregex}.match(${astr})
# ${matchobj}.string, ${matchobj}.group(${0-N}), # ${matchobj}.groups() ${matchobj}.groupdict()
@param editor: Reference to the text editor. @type editor: An Editor object.${cursor}

entry.description: Documentation for Return Value for GObject Signals
entry.template: @return: True to propagate signals to parent widgets. @type: A Boolean Object.${cursor}
@param self: Reference to the ${class} instance. @type self: ${A_or_An} ${class} object.${cursor}
@return: True to call this function again, False otherwise. @rtype: A Boolean object.

# import re ${aregex} = re.compile('${pattern}', re.${UILMSX}) # [re.compile(x) for x in ${pattern_sequence}]
${aseq} = ${aregex}.split(${astr}, ${maxsplit=0})

entry.description: defult strip whitespace else given char
search regex pattern anywhere in a string
entry.template:
# import re ${aregex} = re.compile('${pattern}', re.${UILMSX}) # [re.compile(x) for x in ${pattern_sequence}]
${matchobj} = ${aregex}.search(${astr})
# ${matchobj}.string, ${matchobj}.group(${0-N}), # ${matchobj}.groups() ${matchobj}.groupdict()

entry.description: A set is an unordered collection of items that contains no duplicates

entry.template: ${aset} = set(${expression} for ${item} in ${collection}) # Py3, ${aset} = {${expression} for ${item} in ${collection}}

entry.description: Split a given string around sep
defult strip whitespace else given char

entry.template:
# import re ${aregex} = re.compile('${pattern}', re.${UILMSX}) # [re.compile(x) for x in ${pattern_sequence}]
${astr} = ${aregex}.sub(${replacement}, ${astr}, ${count=0})
This function is called repeatedly unless its return value is False.

entry.description: convert a collection type into list
Tuples are immutable arrays of object references, accessed by offset.

entry.template:
# Python’s built-in object types
# __________ Strings (Character is string length 1) # | # ___________ Primitive ------| # | |__________ Numbers # Core object types -----| __________ Sets # |___________ Compound or | # Collections or |__________ Sequences (strings, lists, tuples, bytes, bytearray) # Containers. | # |__________ Mappings (dictionary)

entry.description: with statement wraps a nested block of code in a context manager
write the string to file object
entry.template: ${file_object}.write(${str}) # Not str, it needs to be converted to a str first
yield ${expression} # next(${var},None) to access the values
